named after the valley of river Kymijoki.

value: content= One of Southern Finland’s most popular hiking destinations.
content= Large mire landscape with plenty of birdwatching opportunities.
content= In outer archipelago, best explored by boat.

There are no passenger airports in Kymenlaakso but frequent connections both to Kouvola and the coastal cities by bus from Helsinki. Trains from Helsinki to all parts of Eastern Finland and Russia pass through Kouvola, and so do many bus lines going in that direction. content=The exhibition is located inside a wooden building built to resemble the style of the war period in Finland. Outdoor part surrounding the museum building includes fortification sites in the forest. Fireplace is nearby.
address=Miehikkälän municipality / Salpa Line Museum in Miehikkälä, Yhdystie 2 B 4, 49700 Miehikkälä
hours=Jun Aug daily 10:00-18:00, May Sep Wed-Sun 10:00-18:00, otherwise by arrangement

content=Indoor exposition and an extensive outdoor exposition (guided tour included in the entrance fee, as well as a short film). Cafeteria and a museum store. Fireplace & BBQ grounds behind the museum.
Kymi river and the dam near Kouvola.
Verla Groundwood and Board Mill in Jaala, Kouvola; a former paper factory that now is an UNESCO World Heritage Site.
content=The Salpa Trail is a 50 km long one-way hiking route between

. It follows a part of the Finnish WW2 defense line (Salpa line). Along the route there are numerous remains of bunkers, dug-outs and other fortifications and several rest-stops. They are equipped with a compost toilet, compost, a fireplace and a firewood shelter and some of them with a lean-to for an over-night stay. The Bunker museum in Virolahti and the Salpa Line museum in Miehikkälä are part of the route.
Have fun at Tykkimäki amusement park in Kouvola
